channel.title: New bill for justifiable homicide
channel.description:
[url='https://motherjones.com/politics/2011/02/nebraska-justifiable-homicide-abortion-bill']Nebraska's proposed bill to allow justifiable homicide for any type of endangerment of a pregnancy[/url]
What do you guys think?

item.title: New bill for justifiable homicide
item.dc:creator: intooblivion
item.description:
Anyway as for the law proposed, someone asked if anyone actually read it, I did.

The whole problem is that the language of the law is EXTREMELY vague, and a lot of it is also up to opinion instead of cut and dry. “using such force to protect himself or herself against the injury he or she believes to be threatened to the (baby)”

Technically, you could give someone a disease that could harm the child. Just being around that person could be said to be threatening injury unto the child, and with the language in the bill the only way you could get out of that situation is to stay away from them, and if they work with you, unless you move you’re shit outta luck.

Read full topic

item.title: New bill for justifiable homicide
item.dc:creator: Fancy_Pants
item.description:
Medevilae:

A rapist by definition has already committed rape, and can’t become a non rapist. Just sayin’

yes i know, but you can prevent future rapes. we live in a fucked up society when rape is so prevalent that so many women will be sexually assaulted in their lives, and we feel the need to teach THEM how to AVOID it instead of teaching the offenders to not do it. and it’s not only an issue with women! women can rape women, men can rape men, men can rape women and women can rape men. it’s ALWAYS an issue, no matter the sex or gender of the offender or the victim.

how rape is viewed needs to change. someone who is raped can be seen as “damaged goods”, or even worse, blamed for their own rape. “they shouldnt have been out late at night” “they shouldn’t have dressed like that” “they should have known who they were with” “they shouldnt have trusted him/her” are all very real things people say about rape victims, and it needs to stop. the only person to blame is the rapist.
people need to stop pretending rape doesnt happen, as well. but another problem is people making it seem like rape is a NORMAL thing, that “just happens” and don’t treat it as an issue.
people need to stop equating rape with ANY kind of sexuality. anybody can be raped. rape is not about physical attraction.
people need to be better educated about rape and the effects it has on society. these are all components of rape culture, and too few people know about it.
of course it wont eradicate rape. nothing will, that’s one of the worst things about the human race. there will always be someone fucked up enough to force themselves on someone else. but i do believe if we change how we view rape, rapists, and rape victims, the amount of rapes will decline and society will be better off as a whole.

Read full topic

item.title: New bill for justifiable homicide
item.dc:creator: Rollofthedice
item.description:
Though, there’s always the people who won’t give two flying fucks about whatever people say, even if they probably need to. People are arrogant and easily offended that way.

Medevilae:

A rapist by definition has already committed rape, and can’t become a non rapist. Just sayin’

(Not @ Fancy) Also, did you think to check Wikipedia’s sources? You might want to actually LOOK at reference #13.

I don’t see any problem, though I admittedly only took a brief glance. That sure looks like U.N. data.

item.title: New bill for justifiable homicide
item.dc:creator: Fancy_Pants
item.description:
dude what no.
https://www.nationmaster.com/graph/cri_rap_percap-crime-rapes-per-capita

5 Canada: 0.733089 per 1,000 people

9 United States: 0.301318 per 1,000 people

no, it cant be eradicated, because the human race is shit. but if society would focus on teaching rapists not to rape instead of teaching victims to avoid rape, it would be a lot better. if men who were raped werent made fun of, and if women who were raped werent shamed or accused of lying, it would be a LOT BETTER. the attitude towards rape needs to change.

and “oh its out of the rapists control!” is extremely rare. that’s another part of rape culture. “oh, he/she just couldn’t hold him/herself back!” is rape apology which is not ok. they RAPED someone. they deserve no pity.

Read full topic

item.title: New bill for justifiable homicide
item.dc:creator: Rollofthedice
item.description:
What I was trying to say was this: You said that Canada is just as bad as America when it comes to rape, when the US has a rape per capita of over twenty times Canada’s. Of course any amount of rape is bad, and I did not imply that it ‘wasn’t so bad.’ I was simply finding yet another inconsistency with what you had said. Don’t try to belittle me just because it “kinda” seems like I was being misogynistic; it’s a lot better to have something concrete to insult me on.

Read full topic

the fact that you say WELL ITS PRETTY LOW ON THE LIST!!! is kinda like saying “ohh well that’s not so baaaad”
which is a product of… guess what? rape culture!

item.description:
Someonerandm:

Wrong. I never said that. Do we treat babies like adults? No. However, we do recognize they have the potential to be adults. The same applies to fetuses.

Yet, isn’t you who said that fetuses ARE babies because have the “potential/likelihood” of becoming babies? So, why are fetuses babies but babies aren’t adults?

item.title: New bill for justifiable homicide
item.dc:creator: Fancy_Pants
item.description:
no, they’re not. she links to her own articles, but there’s ALWAYS a source.

and nowhere did i say it ONLY happens in developed countries. i said it DOES, since everyone seems to think that omg canada and america are good clearly theres none of that here!!

and i dont believe EVERY word they say. obviously i disagree with some of what they say, but what they say in those articles is actually right.

and as for the isolated incidents, the statistics that imonfire posted himself that show that canada has more rape per capita kind of disproves that.

Read full topic

item.title: New bill for justifiable homicide
item.dc:creator: Rollofthedice
item.description:
Fancy Pants:

when have i ever said every man was a rapist, please find that for me. because i definitely dont recall it.

and nope, it acknowledges that men can be raped by women as well. everyone acknowledges that.

this is prevalent in every developed nation who pretends women are equal, like i said before.

https://www.abostonmarriage.com/?p=402
https://shakespearessister.blogspot.com/2010/07/today-in-rape-culture-canadian-style.html
here, this one is worldwide. https://www.gender-focus.com/tag/rape-culture/

dont cry about OMG RANDOM BLOGS, when they cite sources.
and hey cool, i dont give two fucks

Again, those sources from that certain ‘shakespearesister’ link that was posted previously were all by herself. The one you list now is better, but it’s only one single place in Canada - what’s to stop that from just being an isolated incident? Even then, the author (which is obviously incredibly biased) is forming negative conjecture on something that she even thinks is kind of a good thing.

Abostonmarriage.com is, again, only drawing sources from a limited amount of areas in Canada - two. It also only focuses on the actions of two or three people, so you could always safely conclude that they’re just complete idiots and that not every single goddamn person in a civilized country is a victim of ‘rape culture’.

gender-focus.com is exactly like all the others: it is incredibly biased and makes baseless conjecture. Hell, some of the stuff on there goes against what you’ve said yourself: Islamic states have a history of misogyny, but you say that rape culture only happens in “places that pretend women are equal.”

Basically, you are taking feminist articles, with clear feminist bias, and yet you believe every single word of it. You can not trust a person to make a balanced argument if she is a fanatical supporter of one end, and hates the other.

Read full topic

EDIT: Yeah, you’re really hurting your cause. Why not click that “Per-capita” button there so you can see how much worse Canada actually is. Believe it or not, its to be expected that a country with 250 million more people has more rape. Lern2Statistic

Anyway, don’t really know what argument I just interfered in, but I’m gonna bail on it.

item.title: New bill for justifiable homicide
item.dc:creator: Rollofthedice
item.description:
Do you normally rabidly insult everyone who has a different opinion than you, Fancy? I mean, really, this is starting to feel like troll territory. Arguing is fine, but there’s no reason to call people assholes if they’re not really insulting you that personally.

Secondly, I’d like to know how Canada is just as bad, since I’ve never been there and you give no supporting evidence to back up that claim.

EDIT: Oh, hey look Fancy, a moderator mentioned you!

https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=8881&page=3

You must feel so proud.

EDIT TIMES 2:

Fancy Pants:

im sorry, but if you cant read a sentence without capitalization and punctuation you might be illiterate
hate to be the one to have to break it to you

and by the way, that blog cites sources for everything. you lose, try again next time!

All of those sources Are from the same blog. I mean, Jesus Christ. Not only is this a biased source, the author is pulling statistics out of her own ass.

Read full topic
